values.description: Run Terratest integration tests inside VPC (Aurora access)
values.name: dr-daily-report-vpc-tests-dev

source.buildspec:
# CodeBuild buildspec for VPC Integration Tests
#
# Purpose:
#   Runs Terratest (Go) integration tests that require VPC access to Aurora.
#   Triggered by GitHub Actions after successful deployments.
#
# Environment Variables (set by CodeBuild project):
#   - AURORA_HOST, AURORA_PORT, AURORA_DATABASE, AURORA_USER, AURORA_PASSWORD
#   - ENVIRONMENT (dev, staging, prod)
#   - TELEGRAM_API_URL (API Gateway endpoint)
#   - AWS_REGION
#
# Tests Run:
#   - TestCacheFirst* - Cache-first behavior with Aurora fixtures
#   - TestAurora* - Direct Aurora query tests

version: 0.2

phases:
  install:
    runtime-versions:
      golang: 1.21
    commands:
      - echo " Installing Go dependencies..."
      - cd terraform/tests
      - go mod download
      - go install gotest.tools/gotestsum@latest

  pre_build:
    commands:
      - echo " Verifying VPC connectivity to Aurora..."
      - echo "AURORA_HOST=${AURORA_HOST}"
      - echo "AURORA_DATABASE=${AURORA_DATABASE}"
      - echo "ENVIRONMENT=${ENVIRONMENT}"
      - |
        # Quick connectivity check (timeout after 10 seconds)
        timeout 10 bash -c "echo > /dev/tcp/${AURORA_HOST}/3306" && \
          echo " Aurora is reachable at ${AURORA_HOST}:3306" || \
          (echo " Cannot reach Aurora at ${AURORA_HOST}:3306 - VPC config may be incorrect" && exit 1)

  build:
    commands:
      - echo " Running VPC integration tests..."
      - cd terraform/tests
      - |
        # Run tests that require VPC access
        # gotestsum provides better output formatting and JUnit XML reports
        gotestsum --junitfile report.xml --format testname -- \
          -v \
          -timeout 15m \
          -run "TestCacheFirst|TestAurora" \
          ./...

  post_build:
    commands:
      - echo " VPC integration tests completed at $(date)"
      - |
        if [ -f terraform/tests/report.xml ]; then
          echo " Test results saved to report.xml"
          # Print summary
          grep -E '<testsuite|<testcase' terraform/tests/report.xml | head -20 || true
        fi

reports:
  terratest-vpc-tests:
    files:
      - "terraform/tests/report.xml"
    file-format: JUNITXML

cache:
  paths:
    - '/go/pkg/mod/**/*'

values.description: Subnet group for Aurora cluster
values.name: dr-daily-report-aurora-dev

webapp_bucket_arn.description: ARN of the S3 bucket for webapp files

webapp_url.description: Full URL for the Telegram Mini App (users)

webhook_url.description: Lambda Function URL for LINE webhook

config.description: Queue configuration summary for Lambda environment variables

dlq_alarm_arn.description: CloudWatch alarm ARN for DLQ messages (null if alarms disabled)

message_age_alarm_arn.description: CloudWatch alarm ARN for message age (null if alarms disabled)

queue_depth_alarm_arn.description: CloudWatch alarm ARN for queue depth (null if alarms disabled)

alarm_description.constant_value: Alert when DLQ has messages (processing failures detected)
Alert when messages are stuck in queue (processing failed)
Alert when queue depth exceeds threshold (processing too slow)

alarm_sns_topic_arns.description: List of SNS topic ARNs to notify on alarm

allow_s3_event_source.description: Whether to allow S3 to send events to this queue

common_tags.description: Common tags to apply to all resources

data_source.description: Data source for this ETL pipeline (used in tags)

delay_seconds.description: Time (in seconds) to delay message delivery (0 to 900)

dlq_alarm_threshold.description: Number of messages in DLQ before triggering alarm

dlq_message_retention_seconds.description: Time (in seconds) that messages are retained in the DLQ

dlq_visibility_timeout_seconds.description: Visibility timeout for DLQ (short since DLQ messages are not processed)

enable_cloudwatch_alarms.description: Whether to create CloudWatch alarms for queue monitoring

kms_data_key_reuse_period_seconds.description: Time (in seconds) that SQS can reuse a data key (60 to 86400)

kms_master_key_id.description: KMS key ID for SSE-KMS encryption (null = use SSE-SQS managed encryption)

max_message_size.description: Maximum message size in bytes (1024 to 262144)

max_receive_count.description: Number of times a message can be received before moving to DLQ (3-5 recommended for ETL)

message_age_alarm_threshold.description: Maximum age (in seconds) of oldest message before triggering alarm

message_retention_seconds.description: Time (in seconds) that messages are retained in the queue (1 minute to 14 days)

queue_depth_alarm_threshold.description: Number of messages in main queue before triggering alarm (backlog detection)

queue_name.description: Name of the SQS queue (should include environment suffix: -dev, -staging, -prod)

queue_purpose.description: Purpose of this queue (used in tags and documentation)

receive_wait_time_seconds.description: Time (in seconds) for long polling (0 = short polling, 1-20 = long polling)

s3_bucket_arns.description: List of S3 bucket ARNs allowed to send events to this queue

visibility_timeout_seconds.description: Time (in seconds) that a message is invisible after being received (should be 2x max processing time)

bucket_arn.description: The ARN of the data lake bucket

bucket_id.description: The ID (name) of the data lake bucket

bucket_name.description: The name of the data lake bucket

bucket_regional_domain_name.description: The regional domain name of the bucket

common_tags.description: Common tags to apply to all resources

deep_archive_transition_days.description: Number of days before transitioning objects to Deep Archive

enable_cors.description: Enable CORS configuration for direct browser uploads

expiration_days.description: Number of days before objects expire (0 = never)

glacier_transition_days.description: Number of days before transitioning objects to Glacier

project_name.description: Project name used in bucket naming

OPENROUTER_API_KEY.description: OpenRouter API key for the Lambda function (provides access to OpenAI models)

aurora_enabled.description: Enable Aurora MySQL cluster (set to false to skip creation)

aurora_max_acu.description: Maximum ACU capacity for Aurora Serverless v2

aurora_min_acu.description: Minimum ACU capacity for Aurora Serverless v2 (0.5 ACU = ~$43/month)

aws_region.description: AWS region where resources will be created

ecr_repository_name.description: Name of the ECR repository for Lambda container images

lambda_image_tag.description: Docker image tag for Lambda functions (set by CI/CD, e.g., 'v20251201182404'). Use 'latest' only for initial bootstrap.

lambda_memory.description: Memory size for Lambda function in MB

lambda_timeout.description: Timeout for Lambda function in seconds

log_retention_days.description: CloudWatch Logs retention period in days

owner.description: Team or individual responsible for the resources

project_name.description: Project name for resource naming and tagging

telegram_bot_token.description: Telegram Bot Token for Mini App

telegram_webapp_url.description: Telegram Mini App WebApp URL (legacy, use telegram_webapp_urls for multiple)

telegram_webapp_urls.description: List of Telegram Mini App WebApp URLs (for CORS - dev, staging, prod)

terraform_external_id.description: External ID for AssumeRole (optional security measure)

terraform_role_arn.description: ARN of Terraform deployment role (required if use_assume_role = true)

terraform_user_name.description: IAM user name allowed to assume TerraformDeployRole

use_assume_role.description: Whether to use AssumeRole pattern for Terraform operations
